description: Enjoy a comforting meatloaf with creamy mashed potatoes ready in no time! This recipe brings together classic flavors for a family-friendly meal. Try it tonight!
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, onion, ketchup, egg, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Mix until well combined.
Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it in a greased baking dish. Spread a thin layer of ketchup on top for added flavor.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 60 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C). Let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Meanwhile, boil the cubed potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and return them to the pot.
Add the heavy cream and butter to the potatoes, then mash until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve slices of meatloaf alongside a generous scoop of creamy mashed potatoes.
tips: To ensure your meatloaf is moist, avoid overmixing the meat mixture. Use fresh breadcrumbs for better texture, and consider adding chopped herbs for extra flavor. When mashing potatoes, warm the cream and butter slightly to help them blend smoothly. For storage, keep leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat in the oven at 350°F (175°C) until warmed through, about 20 minutes. Always check the internal temperature of the meatloaf to avoid undercooking.

structured_content.content:
Preparation is key to a successful meatloaf. Start by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C) to ensure even cooking. Gather all your ingredients and chop the onion finely to release its flavor. Combine the meat mixture thoroughly, but avoid overworking it to keep the loaf tender.

Preparation phase:
Chop the onion and gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven and prepare your baking dish with a light coating of cooking spray.
Cooking process:
Shape the meat mixture into a loaf and place it in the oven. Bake until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C), which should take about an hour.
Finishing touches:
Let the meatloaf rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with a generous helping of creamy mashed potatoes for a comforting meal.

note.label: Critical Tips You Must Know
note.content:
• Temperature precision: Cooking at the right temperature is crucial for even cooking. Use a meat thermometer to check the internal temperature, aiming for 160°F (70°C).
  • Common mistake to avoid: Overmixing the meat can lead to a dense loaf. Mix just until combined for the best texture.
  • Perfect doneness indicator: Look for a nicely browned exterior and juices running clear when sliced. The meatloaf should feel firm but not dry.
  • Storage & reheating: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat in the oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 20 minutes or until warmed through.

Explore these exciting variations:

  • Vegan/Dairy-Free: Use lentils or chickpeas as a base, and substitute plant-based milk and butter for the mash.

  • Protein swap: Try ground turkey or chicken for a lighter version, adjusting seasonings to enhance flavor.

• Restaurant technique: For a gourmet touch, consider glazing the meatloaf with a mixture of ketchup and brown sugar for a sweet, caramelized crust.
